chk 0.0.1.9023
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Benchmarking chk
  • Changelog

Check Identical, Equal or Equivalent

Source: R/chk-identical.R
chk_identical.Rd

chk_identical() checks if is identical to y using

identical(x, y).

chk_equal() checks if is equal (identical within tolerance) to y using

vld_true(all.equal(x, y, tolerance)).

chk_identical(x, y, x_name = NULL)

chk_equal(x, y, tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps), x_name = NULL)

chk_equivalent(x, y, tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps),
  x_name = NULL)

Arguments

x

The object to check.
y

An object to check against.
x_name

A string of the name of object x or NULL.
tolerance

A non-negative numeric scalar.

Value

NULL, invisibly. Called for the side effect of throwing an error if the condition is not met.

Functions

  • chk_identical: Check Identical

  • chk_equal: Check Equal

  • chk_equivalent: Check Equivalent

    chk_equivalent() checks if is equivalent (equal ignoring attributes) to y using

    vld_true(all.equal(x, y, tolerance, check.attributes = FALSE)).

See also

chk_all_identical()

Examples


# chk_identical
chk_identical(1, 1)
try(chk_identical(1, 1L))
#> Error : `1` must be identical to: 1L.
#> Backtrace:
#>      █
#>   1. ├─base::tryCatch(...)
#>   2. │ └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>   3. │   ├─base:::tryCatchOne(...)
#>   4. │   │ └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   5. │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, names[-nh], parentenv, handlers[-nh])
#>   6. │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>   7. │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   8. ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)
#>   9. ├─base::saveRDS(...)
#>  10. ├─base::do.call(...)
#>  11. ├─(function (what, args, quote = FALSE, envir = parent.frame()) ...
#>  12. └─(function (..., crayon_enabled, crayon_colors, pkgdown_internet) ...
#>  13.   └─pkgdown::build_site(...)
#>  14.     └─pkgdown:::build_site_local(...)
#>  15.       └─pkgdown::build_reference(...)
#>  16.         └─purrr::map(...)
#>  17.           └─pkgdown:::.f(.x[[i]], ...)
#>  18.             └─pkgdown:::data_reference_topic(...)
#>  19.               └─pkgdown:::run_examples(...)
#>  20.                 └─pkgdown:::highlight_examples(code, topic, env = env)
#>  21.                   └─evaluate::evaluate(x, child_env(env), new_device = TRUE)
#>  22.                     └─evaluate:::evaluate_call(...)
#>  23.                       ├─evaluate:::timing_fn(...)
#>  24.                       ├─evaluate:::handle(...)
#>  25.                       │ └─base::try(f, silent = TRUE)
#>  26.                       │   └─base::tryCatch(...)
#>  27.                       │     └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>  28.                       │       └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  29.                       │         └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  30.                       ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)
#>  31.                       ├─base::withVisible(eval(expr, envir, enclos))
#>  32.                       └─base::eval(expr, envir, enclos)
#>  33.                         └─base::eval(expr, envir, enclos)
#>  34.                           ├─base::try(chk_identical(1, 1L))
#>  35.                           │ └─base::tryCatch(...)
#>  36.                           │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>  37.                           │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  38.                           │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  39.                           └─chk::chk_identical(1, 1L)
#>  40.                             └─chk::abort_chk(x_name, " must be identical to: ", y)
#>  41.                               └─chk::err(..., n = n, .subclass = "chk_error")
chk_identical(c(1, 1), c(1, 1))
try(chk_identical(1, c(1, 1)))
#> Error : `1` must be identical to: c(1, 1).
#> Backtrace:
#>      █

# chk_equal
chk_equal(1, 1.00000001)
try(chk_equal(1, 1.0000001))
#> Error : `1` must be equal to: 1.0000001.
#> Backtrace:
#>      █
#>   1. ├─base::tryCatch(...)
#>   2. │ └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>   3. │   ├─base:::tryCatchOne(...)

#>   5. │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, names[-nh], parentenv, handlers[-nh])
#>   6. │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>   7. │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   8. ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)
#>   9. ├─base::saveRDS(...)
#>  10. ├─base::do.call(...)
#>  11. ├─(function (what, args, quote = FALSE, envir = parent.frame()) ...
#>  12. └─(function (..., crayon_enabled, crayon_colors, pkgdown_internet) ...
#>  13.   └─pkgdown::build_site(...)

#>  37.                           │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  38.                           │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)

#>  40.                             └─chk::abort_chk(x_name, " must be equal to: ", y)
#>  41.                               └─chk::err(..., n = n, .subclass = "chk_error")
chk_equal(1, 1L)
chk_equal(c(x = 1), c(x = 1L))
try(chk_equal(c(x = 1), c(y = 1L)))
#> Error : `c(x = 1)` must be equal to: c(y = 1L).
#> Backtrace:
#>      █
#>   1. ├─base::tryCatch(...)

#>   6. │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])

#>   8. ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)

#>  38.                           │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)

# chk_equivalent
chk_equivalent(1, 1.00000001)
try(chk_equivalent(1, 1.0000001))
#> Error : `1` must be equivalent to: 1.0000001.
#> Backtrace:
#>      █
#>   1. ├─base::tryCatch(...)
#>   2. │ └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>   3. │   ├─base:::tryCatchOne(...)
#>   4. │   │ └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   5. │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, names[-nh], parentenv, handlers[-nh])
#>   6. │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>   7. │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>   8. ├─base::withCallingHandlers(...)

#>  25.                       │ └─base::try(f, silent = TRUE)
#>  26.                       │   └─base::tryCatch(...)

#>  32.                       └─base::eval(expr, envir, enclos)
#>  33.                         └─base::eval(expr, envir, enclos)
#>  34.                           ├─base::try(chk_equivalent(1, 1.0000001))
#>  35.                           │ └─base::tryCatch(...)
#>  36.                           │   └─base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
#>  37.                           │     └─base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
#>  38.                           │       └─base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
#>  39.                           └─chk::chk_equivalent(1, 1.0000001)
#>  40.                             └─chk::abort_chk(x_name, " must be equivalent to: ", y)
#>  41.                               └─chk::err(..., n = n, .subclass = "chk_error")
chk_equivalent(1, 1L)
chk_equivalent(c(x = 1), c(y = 1))
